page.title: 07History of Morchard Bishop-1
page.content: The village,for hundreds of years was the property of the Bishop of Exeter, who had a large game and deer park here,hence the name Morchard Bishop. The fields and farmhouse to the S.W. of the village are still called The Parks. There is a local history society,which is particularly interested in the structure and development of old vernacular houses and farm buildings, some of which still exist in this area.The farm 'Wood Barton' was the original domesday Manor,and until 1860 it adjoined the north side of the churchyard. The London Inn was a coaching inn on the turnpike road, outside which is the stone mounting block.Opposite is a building,now converted to housing, which was the collection centre for wool when the woollen industry flourished in Devon.
